summary: This document contains due diligence research results related to JEGE, LLC, including searches for negative media and legal alerts. It highlights connections between campaign contributions to Democratic gubernatorial candidate Gary King and Jeffrey Epstein, a convicted sex offender. The document emphasizes the need for compliance review due to Epstein's associations.

persons.name: Gary King
persons.context: Gary King received campaign contributions linked to an address associated with Jeffrey Epstein, raising concerns about the source of the funds.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is mentioned as a convicted sex offender whose address was linked to campaign contributions received by Gary King.

persons.name: Bruce King
persons.context: Bruce King is mentioned as the father of Gary King and as the former owner of the property sold to Epstein.

persons.name: Bill Richardson
persons.context: Bill Richardson is mentioned in relation to returning campaign contributions linked to Epstein.

persons.name: Steve Terrell
persons.context: Steve Terrell is the journalist who authored the article discussing the campaign contributions linked to Epstein.

connections.description: Gary King received campaign contributions from businesses linked to Jeffrey Epstein's address.
Bruce King sold property to Jeffrey Epstein, which is relevant to the campaign contributions received by Gary King.
Bill Richardson returned campaign contributions linked to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Campaign Contributions Linked to Epstein
events.description: An article reported on campaign contributions received by Gary King from businesses associated with Jeffrey Epstein's address.

events.title: Epstein's Conviction
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was convicted of soliciting sex from minors.

locations: 6100 Red Hook Quarter B3, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Gary King received over $35,000 in campaign contributions from an address linked to Jeffrey Epstein.
Jeffrey Epstein is a convicted sex offender listed in the New York state sex offender registry.
Bruce King sold property to Epstein, which is relevant to the campaign contributions received by Gary King.
Bill Richardson returned campaign contributions linked to Epstein in 2006.
The document emphasizes the need for compliance review due to Epstein's associations.
